abstract: Decades between Geraldine Ferraro's historic run for vice president on Democratic ticket in 1984 and Hillary Clinton's clinching of Democratic presidential nomination in 2016 illustrate ways American attitudes toward women in politics have changed, and how they have not; increased prominence of women on political stage has served to partially obliterate memories of when they were rare.

headline.print_headline: For Perspective on Clinton, Step Back 32 Long Years
headline.main: To Understand Clinton’s Moment, Consider That It Came 32 Years After Ferraro’s

snippet: A look back to when Geraldine A. Ferraro was on the Democratic ticket in 1984 can tell a lot about how the country has changed, and how it has not.
lead_paragraph: A look back to when Geraldine A. Ferraro was on the Democratic ticket in 1984 can tell a lot about how the country has changed, and how it has not.
